TopicTitle: Does anyone know a good video editing software ?

Articles.Content:
I am kinda newb at this. I managed to produce the raw footage, but now I need to cut it into the final video and add a voice over. Does anyone know a good and preferably free video editing software ? What are u using to make your youtube videos ?

Edited May 27, 2013 by MBobrik

If your running windows OS you could use the built in windows movie maker for the basic stuff. If you want to do anything fancier go for Lightworks. It has a free version but could take you a while to get the hang of, maybes refer to some YouTube tutorials. If you ever find you need even more powerful softwear Abode Premier Elements is a good steeping-stone into the world of being slightly poorer.
Get Vegas. It costs ~50$ and there is a free version.
I use AVIdemux as my video editor. Does cutting/inserting/re encoding. You can add a separate sound stream into the encoding process for voice overs.

How serious are you about making videos? If this is a one-time only kind of project, then maybe one of the free options will work well enough. My personal experience has been that none of the free or low-budget options are worth the aggravation of dealing with all their bugs and limited features. I eventually shelled out the $90 for Vegas Movie Studio Platinum, and couldn't be happier.

I use Windows Movie Maker for my videos. It's extremely primitive compared to packages like Vegas, Premier, or After Effects, but it's free, and a lot easier and faster to use, as long as you don't need anything fancy.

I use Windows Movie Maker for my videos. It's extremely primitive compared to packages like Vegas, Premier, or After Effects, but it's free, and a lot easier and faster to use, as long as you don't need anything fancy.

Agreed! Most people I watch just use movie maker, and they have about 1k subs.
